name: The Green Iguana Hotel

reviews.text: There were 6 of us traveling through St Thomas on our way to Tortola, BVI. We were able to book rooms for one night during high season, which was nice. Sue & Buddy are managers and they were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and very adequate for our overnight stay.
reviews.title: Great view of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Green Iguana for one night after taking a liveaboard sailing class in St. Thomas. I based the booking from reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. It was a lovely room with a great view. We did the Blackbeard's tour next door and walked down the 99 steps in to town for some shopping and for dinner. The owners are so helpful and they helped us with recommendations for dinner and calling us a cab for the airport. A lovely place located conveniently to town and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Green Iguana- Great place for an overnight stay

likes.liked: — the lovely room with the view of town

reviews.text: We stayed at The Green Iguana for one night before we picked up a sailboat charter. For a night it was a very nice room in a good location at a great price. We checked in and walked into Charlotte Amalie for shopping and dinner. The hotel was clean, Sue was friendly and helpful and the experience more than met our expectations. For a longer stay it would not have worked for us, I would have wanted to be closer to the beach,. However, they have guests who stay longer. My recommendation would be for for a night or two, as part of a vacation vs. the destination of your vacation.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the price; perfect for a night or 2 layover

likes.liked: — It was a great value, reasonable price for the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was fine. We didn't think we could walk to town, but found that it is possible (if you're willing to walk up and down a steep hill) . There was cable and a view of the city. The room was large enough, with the balcony. However, the bed, sheets, and towels weren't soft/comfortable. The bathroom could definitely use some updating.
reviews.title: Okay place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't get to see the green iguana, but I probably would have been terrified, anyway!
reviews.title: Great Hotel- Needs a new location

likes.liked: — friendly atmosphere, garden area, ocean view

reviews.text: I stayed at the Green Iguana for only one night, and it turned out to be exactly what I was looking for. It’s located right next to Blackbeard’s Castle, and is a five-minute walk (via the 99 stairs) from the Charlotte Amalie shopping district. My room (H-2) was small but just fine. After a week in non-air-conditioned Tortola, it was a pleasure to stay for a night in a cool room with dish TV and a modern bathroom. My room had a little refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, and coffee maker. My deck had a wonderful view of part of the city and of the hills above the Green Iguana. The only negative regarding the Green Iguana is that its management seems big on rules and is not very flexible. For example, my request to check out an hour late (noon instead of 11 a.m.) was denied – the first time that has happened to me in more than 30 years of extensive travel. Also, you are given a code that opens the front entrance, and if you forget the code and it’s after 8 p.m., there is no one to call and you have to spend the night outside, I was told by the folks who run the place. Again, that seems a bit inflexible to me. While I realize there are good reasons for establishing checkout times (the rooms need to be cleaned for subsequent lodgers) and asking customers to remember an entrance code (the property managers have a life too, and don’t want to be bothered by late-night travelers who have locked themselves out), part of me thinks that, hey, they’re in the lodging business and being inconvenienced by a customer once in a while comes with the territory.
reviews.title: Nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Still, I was very pleased with my stay at the Green Iguana, and I found it to be a clean, well-located place to stay at a fair price.
reviews.title: Great Hote & Great View!
Convenient and welcoming
reviews.text: The Green Iguana was able to accomodate us on a last minutes notice. The manager was very kind and helpful. The room was nice and clean and the view was beautiful. It was very helpful to have a full kitchen in the room.
Take the ferry to St. John, sit back and enjoy the gorgeous beaches!
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for!!!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before ferrying to Tortola for a charter. It is very well located - above the fray of downtown but an easy and interesting stroll down the 99 steps (10 minutes) and you are there. Linda and Michael are midwesterners and very welcoming. The rooms are all different - we really liked the two we had for our party. You can cook there though we didn't. We're coming back.
reviews.title: Not all that

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Green Iguana for 2 nights as a means to extend our vacation from 5 days to 7 days. We were pleasantly surprised when we showed up and were led to our room. I didn't have to check in or do anything, Sue met us at the entrance and walked us straight to our room and that was that. We were very happy with the overall cleanliness and look of the room. There was a slight ant problem in the bathroom but they leave bug spray under the sink so I just sprayed around the cracks the ants were getting through and that pretty much solved the problem. It wasn't major enough to make me feel the place was dirty, I figured it was just part of being in the location they were in. The view from our room was nice, part of it was of the town and the other was of the water/island. My only issue was with the house keeping, the women came by my room around 10am to ask if we needed anything and we said no, not at the moment and I guess to her this meant we didn't need the room changed over. We figured when we left she would have came back and did the routine change over but when we returned to our room that evening nothing was changed. Same garbage was in the cans, bed wasn't made and towels weren't replaced. Not a huge deal since we were only staying 2 nights but if you stay make sure to clarify you would like your room made up if the lady comes at an inconvenient time.
reviews.title: We loved it here!

reviews.text: We loved this place. Yes, it's away from town, but it's quiet except the occasional rooster. The owners are wonderful and very helpful, even took us into town. We are in our 50's and the 99+ stairs were a wonderful workout and fun to check out. The view of the bay from our room was breath taking. It's great for everyone who just wants a quiet charming place to stay. Blackbeard's Castle is right next door. The only problem would be if someone had a severe handicap, but it would still be do able.
reviews.title: Home away from home.

likes.liked: — The privacy of the B& B and the owners helpfulness.
likes.disliked: — The roosters crowing,I was not used to it. But just shut the patio door and it was fine.

reviews.text: Four couples in all stayed there, and then three stayed again this January before another sailing charter. Would definitely stay again and recommend it to others. We all loved it.
reviews.title: Truly a Sanctuary

likes.liked: — ease on maing arrangements, great staff, proximity to town, kitchen availability. good breeze so no need for air
likes.disliked: — cooking equipment could be better quality for people who really want to cook (like me)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Green Iguana for several days when first coming to St. Thomas as was looking for an apartment to rent. Great place to come back to after a day running around looking at apartment and doing errands and having a hectic time. This place felt like a sanctuary – restful, quiet. The view was great to wake up to before starting back out in the world. I had read that the 99 steps and the walk from downtown were difficult. I found it quick and easy. Plus I met several local people (and some tourists) getting their daily exercise or just coming home from work. I never felt unsafe as there were always friendly people around. I enjoyed talking to Sue, ½ of the management team of the Green Iguana, was great to talk with. I felt that I was among friends and appreciated her job encouragement.
reviews.title: Effortless to work with!

reviews.text: The Green Iguana is basic. But it is clean, well-maintained, well-located, and of course, affordable.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
great place to stay in town
reviews.text: Great staff, very helpful. Great view, great location.
Nice room, wish others on the island were as nice.
reviews.title: Green Iguana was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only issue is that I honestly can't see how one could stay more than one day in town, since there is no night life, and there are no beaches.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I stayed here with his parents for one night before heading over to St John. We booked it based on reccommendations from various websites/forums. The TripAdvisor feedback clinched it for us.
reviews.title: Just what we were expecting

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, felt like family and morning coffee on the balcony.
likes.disliked: — The annoying morning wake-up calls from the rooster down the hill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the two balcony rooms and they were awesome! The balcony is very large with big comfy chairs and a table. I actually fell asleep in one of the chairs.
reviews.title: Well-priced, very nice

aka: The Green Iguana Hotel St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
description: The Green Iguana offers superb amenities with the comforts of home. The Hotel is centrally located within a short walk to the Town Charlotte Amalie, and 15 minutes by taxi from the airport. The Hotel has the perfect combination of harbor views, downtown shopping, museums, and great restaurants, ferry transit and beautiful Caribbean Sunsets! Enhanced by the service of the resident managers to answer questions, guests are treated like family.
